story: One day, Alice saw a strange rabbit running through the grass. The rabbit had a large watch in its hand and ran off saying "Oh dear! Oh dear! I shall be late. Very late!"
Alice chased the rabbit and fell in a deep, dark hole. After that, she faced many trials in Wonderland. Some of her experiences were fun, while others, terrifying...
The next thing she knew, Alice was back in the real world. The same warm afternoon. A world without freedom. Alice felt uneasy. Something was amiss. What in the world could it be?
Peace and boredom... Alice came to a realization. Freedom breeds isolation. Alice sought a life of "Bondage" and once again returned to the deep, dark hole.
The prince's kiss woke Snow White, who had been condemned to eternal slumber. As the evil queen pleaded for her life, Snow White took pity and forgave her transgression.
But just then, the queen came at her with a dagger. The prince tried to protect her, and the dagger pierced his chest.
The next thing Snow White knew, her pure white dress was made blood red. She held the queen's dagger in her hands and looked down at her dying prince...and the tumbling corpse of the queen.
Snow White wailed. "Never. Never. I'll never forgive this. I'll use my sense of Justice to make the world a better place..."\nHer eyes were wild with vengeance.
"Don't forget to give her this letter," Mother said. I took the letter with some bread and strawberry jam and headed toward the forest where Grandma lives.
"Grandma's eyes aren't what they used to be... Could she even read it?"\n"Don't worry. She's fine. But there's something else to watch out for," Mother said as she approached me.
I saw myself reflected in Mother's uneasy eyes, but I waited to hear what she had to say. "Wear this red hood..."
"I wore this when I was a girl, and Grandma wore it, too." The hood was warm and smelled like Mother.\nIt made me so very happy. But for some reason...it seemed to reek of blood.
Shoot the head. Shoot the ear. Shoot the eyes. Shoot the arm. Shoot the shoulder. Shoot the cheek. Shoot the arm. Shoot the foot. Shoot the nose. Shoot the brain. Shoot the bones. Shoot the meat.

Shoot the thumb. Shoot the index finger. Shoot the middle finger. Shoot the ring finger. Shoot the little finger. Shoot the father. Shoot the mother. Shoot the older sister. Shoot the little sister. Shoot the brother. Shoot the child.

Shoot the conscience. Shoot the hypocrisy. Shoot the good intentions. Shoot the desires. Shoot the future. Shoot the peace. Shoot the blessings. Shoot the equality. Shoot the conscience. Shoot the love.
And that's how you destroy everything.\nWhat would I shoot last?\nI already knew the answer.
"Good morning, Papa!" Geppetto couldn't believe his eyes when Pinocchio greeted him so warmly. "What's this?! My puppet Pinocchio is moving!" Pinocchio smiled.
"The fairy gave me life. She said if I behaved, she'd make me a real boy!" Pinocchio cried with joy as he said those words. "It looks like my wish has finally come true!"
"Pinocchio. Be thankful for the blessing you've received and live a good, just life. Tell no lies. Always study hard. If you do, you're sure to become a real boy."
Pinocchio quivered with excitement at Geppetto's words. "If I just do everything he says without question, everything will work out. Without question... Without..."

A princess was cursed by an old fairy who had been denied an invitation to see her child's birth. "For this grievance, at the age of fifteen, she will prick her finger on the spindle of a spinning wheel and perish."
True to her threat, the princess succumbed to the curse in her fifteenth year. But another fairy said, Rather than perish, she will sleep one hundred years instead. Thus, the princess avoided death.
"Only one hundred years?" The princess opened one bleary eye and tilted her head. "I would have preferred to sleep another hundred. Perhaps a thousand."

Why must the waking world be so complicated? A life of dreams is far better. She never asked for a complete stranger to wake her and make her his bride. The princess set off on a quest to find another sleeping curse.

Hansel and Gretel were two siblings, lost in a forest. They came across a gingerbread house and were almost devoured by a witch. They managed to work together to kill the witch and find their way home.

What awaited them at home was more wickedness in the form of parents. Their mother screamed at them. Their father beat them. The siblings cried and ran far, far away. "Help us! Help us! Help us! Help us!"

It was then that Gretel realized she was alone. Her father and mother sprawled on the bloody floor...next to the body of a child she'd truly never seen before. And yet Hansel, her beloved brother, was nowhere to be found.

Gretel wandered the forest with no one to hold her hand. Before she knew it, she found herself carrying a dangling birdcage. What was that strange skull trapped inside? It made a clanking sound. Clank-clank, clank-clank, clank-clank.
Testimony 1: Villager\n"Princess Kaguya? I've been told she's quite lovely, but didn't she emerge from a bamboo shoot and reach adulthood in only three months? Kind of disturbing, if you ask me."
Testimony 2: Old Man\n"Ever since I found her, I've gotten gold and silver with ease. Life has gotten so much better."
Testimony 3: Old Woman\n"She's like a goddess to us. We'd never want her to marry a bad man."
Testimony 4: Nobleman\n"She's not human. Her beauty leads to ruin. Everyone needs to realize that before she relieves them of their body and soul."

Chart: 0231 [Observations]\nShe looks ordinary at first glance. There is not yet any evidence of the self-harm and violence towards others indicated in the reports. I've prescribed sedatives and stabilizers.
Chart: 0542 [Progress]\nShe speaks in an incomprehensible tongue late at night. The nurses are afraid of her, so I've been treating her myself.
Chart: 1016 [Progress]\nHer symptoms are showing improvement. I've increased the stabilizer dosage. She appears to be taking them as directed.
Chart: 1231 [Progress]\nHer symptoms are no longer improving. A wasted effort. I'm going to increase the stabilizer dosage. But not for her... For me.

Interim Report on Library Characters
Name: Snow White
Origin: Germany, Europe
Traits: Her white appearance could symbolize justice and chastity, but it is also strongly suggestive of emptiness.
First appearance: Grimm's Fairy Tales\nA collection of fairy tales compiled by brothers Jacob and Wilhelm Grimm. There is also an Ehrenberg manuscript with differing content.

Past: Envious of Snow White's beauty, her mother drove her from the castle and into the woods, where she found a new home among a band of dwarves. Her mother then attempted to finish her off with a poisoned apple.

Present: She appears to have been rescued by a prince. They were married at the castle, and even to which her mother was invited. It seems the newlyweds have vanished without a trace. Observation will continue.

Interim Report on Library Characters
Name: Red Riding Hood
Origin: Germany, Europe
Traits: Her red appearance symbolizes love and destruction, but it is also strongly suggestive of gluttony and lust.
First appearance: Grimm's Fairy Tales\nA collection of fairy tales from all over Europe compiled by brothers Jacob and Wilhelm Grimm.

Past: A wolf broke into Red Riding Hood's grandmother's house and devoured her. He then proceeded to eat Red Riding Hood as soon as she arrived. Soon after, a passing hunter noticed something was amiss and cut the wolf open, saving the pair of them.

Present: It's unclear whether or not Red Riding Hood survived the wolf encounter. Because we've lost contact with our previous reporter, we urgently request a fifth to be assigned to the investigation.

The girl was forced to live covered in cinders to hide her coveted, hated beauty. She swallowed her pride and acquiesced to her stepmother and stepsisters, wearing only shabby clothing and settling for meals of leftover scraps.
She had not a single soul to turn to. So she lied to herself, insisting that a roof over her head was enough. Kicked and beaten like an animal, her beautiful face would swell to something ugly.

And because of her beauty and pitifulness, she attracted magical intervention. Just as her heart was on the verge of being consumed by darkness, a miracle occurred. A fairy godmother, both praised and feared by others, smiled in anticipation.

Beautiful girl. Pitiable girl. Cinder-soiled girl. Who was this miracle really for? But the girl already knew. That was the hypocrisy of it all. All that was left for her to do was make the best of her newly granted freedom...
Testimony 1: Master Cherry\n"I was amazed! I mean, the log could talk! I heard it groaning in the lumberyard. I wish you could have been there to hear it."
Testimony 2: Geppetto\n"My puppet-making skills are second to none. I look at a log and see what it can become. That said..."
Testimony 3: Geppetto\n"Pinocchio was a liar. He hated studying and didn't want to make the effort. I didn't hate him for it, though. His will to live was stronger than that of most people."
Testimony 4: Cricket\n"Don't ask me. It happened to both Cherry and Geppetto. Everyone who squeals on him disappears. It's bound to happen to me, too..."
The country had thirteen wizards. The strongest among them was able to see into the future, where he saw a beautiful princess enduring terrible hardships.
At around the same time, a king and queen, who had struggled to have children, managed to have a daughter. They discussed having the wizards bless the beautiful baby girl.

Knowing the horrible future that awaited her, the thirteenth wizard proposed to cast a spell that would ensure her death when she was at her most beautiful. But the other twelve wizards, blind to what was to come, overruled him.
But the thirteenth wizard could not let such a grisly fate befall the poor, lovely little girl. So it was that he snuck into the forbidden castle and cast the spell anyway.

Among the deep greens of the bamboo forest, there was one bamboo shoot that seemed to shine. The light inside glowed as if it was quietly waiting for the right person.
The baby inside the bamboo shoot was dreaming. Why was she here? What happened to her? As she began to doze off, her memory grew hazy and eventually faded with the scent of bamboo.
In her gentle slumber, the bamboo baby set the sky ablaze. The golden moon floated in the night sky. The light that shone on the bamboo stretched up toward the moon like a ladder.

She continued to sleep, not knowing anything. Just a pure and innocent child. From the second she was born, she would be promised to a world of impurities and vulgarities. It would be a crime for which she could never atone.

My mother was kind and beautiful. "You're going to grow up to be beautiful," she would say as she played with my hair with her lovely, delicate hands. I loved hearing her say that. I thought I would grow to be as beautiful as her.

When did it start to happen? When did my mother start looking at me with frightened eyes? Was it when the servant taking care of me killed herself? Or when the minister was murdered? "You're terrifying." Words I will never forget...

My mother would look in the mirror all day long. "Mirror, mirror, on the wall. Who's the fairest of them all?" Not wanting to hear the answer, I left the castle. I did not want to be near my mother when she heard the answer, either.

I found myself living with dwarfs for a time. One day, an old woman appeared. "Would you like an apple?"\n"I would love one," I replied. I knew what would happen next, but I sunk my teeth into the apple anyway. I would give anything to return Mother to her old self...even my own life.
Cotton candy clouds gently floated by. Chomp-chomp, chomp-chomp. The sky devoured them as they drifted...
...splashing away in a beautiful, wretched pool of blood. It's warm! And feels ever so lovely on my skin.
A massive N I G H T M A R E castle rose toward the L I B R A R Y sky.\n*Tap tap tap*\nI knock S M A S H on the H E A D door and T A K E  A  L O O K step inside. H E L L O.
In my dreams, I'm free. A beautiful princess in the clouds... In the real world, I'm a slumbering killer who murders with briar thorns.
Father... Mother...\n                           Didn't you love us?
You've taken us\nto the forest so many times\n                    You left us to die.
You leave us, and we return. Then you leave us again. It's all so very sad.
But Father... Mother...\nWe love you no matter what.\n                    That's why we always come back...

There once was an old man. He shaved the wood, smoothed it, fashioned it into limbs, clothed it... And a puppet was born. Unable to have a child of his own, the old man wished for it to become a real boy.
He made a wish to the fairy of the stars. He didn't expect anything to come of it, but the fairy heard his wish and gave the puppet life.
Why did the fairy grant his wish? Did she do it on a whim or as part of some kind of revelation? The old man had no way of knowing. He was simply grateful that his puppet had been given life.

The fairy looked down at the simple-minded, selfish puppet who continued to tell vulgar jokes in front of the good-natured old man. She had no idea that behind the puppet's eyes was a hollow of darkness...

There was once a beautiful girl. But, envious of her beauty, her stepmother and stepsisters forced her into a life of servitude. They called the girl Cinderella, for she spent her life covered in cinders and ash.

One day, an invitation from the castle arrived. The prince was looking to marry and would be holding a ball. Her stepmother and stepsisters dressed in satin, silk, and jewels. Cinderella, meanwhile, resigned herself to another night of scrubbing.

A fairy took pity on Cinderella and enchanted her that night. So beautiful was Cinderella that she easily won the prince's heart. But she was forced to flee the ball before her enchanted ensemble wore off...

It was only due to a glass slipper, left behind, that Cinderella and her prince married. But what of the stepmother and stepsisters? They were subject to the cruelest revenge at the hands of Depravity. Their deaths were slow and quite painful.
Freedom\nTo follow your heart without being confined by others. To not have physical restrictions "To celebrate freedom."
Dream\nA series of images you see when sleeping. Sensations outside of reality. A wish you want to achieve in the future. "To fulfill a dream."
Pleasure\nPhysical or mental stimulation that feels good. A feeling you have when satisfying your desires. "Indulge in pleasure."
Bondage\nBeing restrained and having your freedom taken away. Something a dominant person does to someone against their will when they've been captured. "Seek bondage."\n
The nocturnal beast was frightened. A shadow wandered through the woods, spreading darkness as it danced, becoming eternal. That is how the Dark Forest came to be.

His land was deep in the woods, protected by the trees and their sturdy branches. He and the villagers, who lived as one with the forest, knew how to read the wind. The wind whispered a disturbing tale. It brought news of the shadow and the nocturnal beast it had consumed.

Even if you understood the wind, it was still a capricious force. It is said when the forest is swallowed up by a nocturnal beast, a red-cloaked one would protect it. "That's why we wrap ourselves in red," the village chief told his people by the fire.

As usual, the girl donned a red hood and set off into the trees. She saw sunlight through the woods and heard lilting birdsongs. She prayed she wouldn't get lost in the Dark Forest. To this day, no one knows the true nature of the nocturnal beast.
Bamboo Cutter\n[Noun] An old man who makes a living cutting bamboo. He found Princess Kaguya in a bamboo shoot. After that, he became rich with silver and gold.
Princess Kaguya\n[Noun] A baby found in a bamboo shoot. Bamboo Kaguya. A beautiful woman. Many men sought her hand in marriage. She challenged and refused them all.
Miracle Birth\n[Noun] Refers to children born in unusual, impossible ways. Princess Kaguya was born from bamboo and reached adulthood in three months.
Masochism\n[Noun] The enjoyment of being mistreated and abused. Princess Kaguya's desire. An eager desire.\n
Far down below, at the bottom of the sea and inside a quiet coral forest, stood a mer-king's castle. His youngest daughter was inquisitive and energetic. She dreamt of someday seeing the human world.

One evening, the mermaid princess saved a human prince that was shipwrecked by a storm. It was love at first sight. But because of what she was, she couldn't tell him how she felt. She decided to become human.

She traded away her voice, and in exchange, received a pair of legs. Every step she took was like walking on a bed of nails. Despite the agony, she hurried to the prince, only to find that he was in love with someone else.

If only she could kill the prince, then she could be a mermaid once more. But she couldn't bring herself to murder one she loved so dearly. The sadness. The tears of lost love. She was absolutely inconsolable...
How could you forget? I'm the one that saved you.\nHow could you love another? I'm the one that you kissed.\nI became human for you. Was that not enough?
Hate. Pain. Sadness. My heart has lost its rhythm. My head, coherence. Must love be arduous? Must love be sadness? Must love be misery? Love...
Love...is delicious.
I saved the prince and turned to froth. A tragedy. For this reason, my story will never be forgotten, and the world will continue to tell of my pitiable existence. Oh, it's so wonderful!
Floating, fluttering in the blue depths.\nDrifting as foam on the waves.\nOver all the love in this world, I cast my gaze.
Joyful love, delightful love.\nMournful love, frightful love.\nLove has is made of endless forms.
But a tear-stained love\nof broken hearts\nlooked most beautiful to me.
Love that's pure joy is sure to wither and die with time.\nLove that's pure sadness is eternal. Love that's pure mourning is the truest of all.\nAnd so, that is what I...will...give to...y o u.

Long ago, there existed a bamboo cutter. He harvested bamboo within the wild forests, perfect for a myriad of applications. Within the forest stood a single glowing reed. A woman of incredible beauty sat inside of it, no more than a few inches in height.

He brought the bamboo princess home with him, and soon she'd doubled in size in his care. No more than three months later, she was the size of a fully-grown woman, and so she entered into the adult world.

Men of the world in positions both high and low began to murmur, "How I would love to take Princess Kaguya's hand."\n"How I would love to wed her."\nPrincess Kaguya heard this and muttered, "Oh, how pointless."

The princess wanted not to be satisfied, but to satisfy. She wanted not to be waited upon, but to wait upon. She wanted to be taken by force. The masochistic Princess wanted only the strongest, but to this day, her desires go unfulfilled.

The sky is cloudy and gray. The wind is cold. In this land of nothing, I had only my studies. I worked as a math teacher in a school. Every single day was gray. My only pleasure was spinning stories...
I have no one to share my interest with. My passion was not understood by a single person. Her pure innocent soul rescued me. I put her wonderful existence down for eternity in my writings.
But lately her behavior has been making me uncomfortable. I don't understand why... She is as beautiful and as innocent as ever. My love for her remains constant.
Finally, she ignores my opinion and starts. I am a neglected creator. I could only beg her forgiveness through the tears. I was broken...as was this story...
I prayed to the night sky.\nI wished upon a star.\nIlluminated by the moon.
An act of whimsy on a starry night.\nWhimsy that breathed life into my words.\nThat whispered life into my body.
I was created.\nI was constructed.\nI think I was born.

The wish had come true.
And it murmured.
I don't care if this is all a lie...

There once was a cute girl who always loved to play. She was called Red Riding Hood, after the beautiful red velvet hood she always wore. One day, Red Riding Hood's mother asked her to go on an important errand.

With gifts for her ailing grandmother in hand, Red Riding Hood headed toward a cottage deep in the woods. Along the way, she was tempted by a wolf she met and decided to make a detour to have a little fun.
The wolf arrived at her grandmother's home first and swallowed up the old woman. Then he pretended to be Red Riding Hood's granny, and tricked her once she arrived, swallowing her up as well.

Later, a hunter saved both Red Riding Hood and her grandmother by slicing open the belly of the sleeping wolf. Of course...that wasn't enough fun for Red Riding Hood. She still wanted to play with that mean, old wolf.

Imagine a time far, far into the past\nIn a small, average town, lived a young girl. She loved her family very much. So—like any other loving child—she murdered them all. How else could she make sure that no wicked souls tried to harm them?

Imagine a place far, far across the sea.\nEnvision a girl brandishing a sword, storming onto the battlefield. The girl would go on to enslave all the women and children of the villages she attacked under the orders of her god. The girl then sold her victims into slavery.

Imagine a world far, far from here.\nThere was a girl who loved a man, and delighted to find she was to bear his child. However, when the man learned of the life now growing inside her, he cast her out. In agony, the woman cursed the world, and flung her body from the highest tower.

Imagine a time far, far in the future.\nThere was a girl who loved her creator. Of course, there was no way for her to know if her creator was real. In fact, there was no way to know if what she felt was love.
Something red.\nStrawberries, apples, tomatoes, and cherries.
Something red.\nRoses, scarlet sage, dahlias, and amaryllis.
Something red.\nLips, tongues, organs and blood.
All that's red is so lovely and tasty.
Scholar's Diary, Part 1:\nSleeping Beauty, of the slumbering forest... Is she truly happy now that the prince's kiss has awakened her?
Scholar's Diary, Part 2:\nThe literature says she had two children after marriage, but that they were eaten by the prince's mother.
Scholar's Diary, Part 3:\nOther sources state she was ravaged by the prince while sleeping, waking only after she'd birthed his children.
Scholar's Diary, Part 4:\nOne must ultimately wonder if she'd have been happier staying asleep.
The prince chose me from among all the well-dressed girls twirling about the hall. "May I have this dance, beautiful lady?"\n"With pleasure," I smiled. Ah—what a simple man.
I let him lead me, with my bashful, watering eyes. I love their jealous glares. Just look at the faces of my mother and my sisters!\n"What a perfect night."\n"Yes, it is."
How do you like it, this cinder-soiled girl stealing your prince? How does your despair taste?\n"I wish I could make you vanish," you say. My generous heart can find pity for you.
Now, my prince, find me. Use the glass shoe, that spider's strand I left behind. I will enslave your heart, tame your body, then toss you away like a tattered rag...
An android formally known as "YoRHa No.2 Type B" was built to combat machine lifeforms. Her mission is to annihilate machine lifeforms alongside support unit Pod 042.
2B has a calm personality and tends to hide her emotions. The repeated destruction endured in her many battles seems to have affected the formation of her personality.
The No.2 model is based on the only surviving prototype test model, whose high adaptability proved useful in various operations.
There are YoRHa models outside of the Type B. The Type E is tasked with the destruction of friendly units to prevent information leaks, and thus has notably higher combat skills than other models.
An information processing android known as "YoRHa No.9 Type S" was built to fight machine lifeforms. His mission is to survey machine lifeforms alongside support unit Pod 153.
The curious 9S often gets sidetracked from his primary mission. This characteristic comes from the original No.9 design pattern used in his creation.
While 9S is a skilled hacker, he also possesses data on dangerous enemy attack patterns. Though hobbies are against YoRHa regulations, he seems to enjoy studying for pleasure.
He is often employed alongside the No.2 Type B model upon orders from Command. He tends to suffer massive damage or destruction more often than other models.
An android formally known as "YoRHa Type A No.2" was built for close combat against machine lifeforms. This model was initially deployed in the Pearl Harbor mission during the 14th Machine War.
A2 is a prototype YoRHa model. While both Types A (Attacker) and G (Gunner) existed at first, they were merged to make the Type B (Battler) at the time of deployment.
During the Pearl Harbor mission, her job was to destroy the enemy server in Mt. Ka'ala that controlled machine lifeforms across the Pacific Ocean.
Though 12 YoRHa units were deployed, all but A2 were destroyed. While A2 survived to destroy the enemy server, her current whereabouts are unknown.

Heat sinks are installed on all operating YoRHa models. These siphon away the heat generated from their fusion reactors during battle as much as possible.
These parts are found on the skirt area of female YoRHa units. They reach temperatures of 100 centigrade under heavy duress, often requiring liquid cooling and other countermeasures.
Temporary performance gains can be achieved by removing these, but battle without them should only continue for up to 30 minutes due to reduced heat dissipation efficiency.
As YoRHa combat equipment prioritizes armor over heat dissipation, cooling liquid from an all-purpose backpack is used to circulate in the suit and remove heat.

Will filling my empty stomach bring me happiness?\nThen I'll eat until I burst.
Will spending money bring me fulfillment?\nThen I'll earn so much cash I can burn it for warmth.
But it's not enough. No matter how much I gain, I am not satisfied.
I found no answers in my successes.\nFor what I seek is the loss of my self.
There was once written the tale of a girl's journey. Caught in a tornado, she is taken to a wondrous, unknown land where she forms connections with the new friends she finds there.
Her travels tell of a scarecrow who longs for a brain, a tin lumberjack who pines for a heart, a cowardly lion who seeks courage, and a girl whose only desire is for home.
She learns through her journey the meaning of strength, friendship, and wishes. It is the story of a girl's growth, and a parable in regards to the desires of her friends.
It is a great literary work, full of mystery, adventure, and hope. But her friends don't realize what nightmares can stem from a brave girl's endless curiosity...
(Excerpt from the soldier's diary)\nI caught a glance of the princess from my window. How divine her countenance. I would be ready to give anything for her, even my life.
(Excerpt from the handmaid's diary)\nThe princess is just so beautiful. Even I find myself fantasizing about her. Oh, princess, my princess...
(Excerpt from the minister's diary)\nAll of these suitors from neighboring lands... But I'll never let her go. I befit the white princess most of all.
(Excerpt from the queen's diary)\nThat girl's mere existence drives our subjects to madness. She'll soon cause a war if nothing is done. I have no choice...
An adorable princess was once born to a kingdom. This pleased its long-childless king greatly, and he held a grand banquet to which twelve magicians were invited.
Each of the magicians blessed the princess in turn. But an uninvited thirteenth magician appeared, cursing her to die at fifteen, pricked by the spindle of a spinning wheel.
The last remaining magician managed to turn it into a curse of sleep rather than death, but the vile spell was cast all the same. The princess fell into the deep sleep, as promised.
Years later, a prince who'd heard rumors of the princess undid her curse. Awakened, she spoke to him. "Why in the world would you wake me up? Can't you tell I'm tired? Piss off!"
I want to meet him... But what if my wish is never fulfilled?\nI can't bear the thought. That torrent of emotions will take hold of me. Someone... Someone please help me.
My heart breaks. My heart. Breaks. Heart. Breaks.\nI hear the demons whisper. There's no point.\nI hear what the song says. Life has no meaning.
It hurts... Hurts...\nHe... I... Want... Who am I?
Ahhh, yes. I just need to kill.\nEnemies. Author. Kill them all.\nThen, at last, myself...
"Let's abandon those two." Mother's voice came from the next room, emotionless. Father must have silently nodded. Hansel held me gently as I sobbed uncontrollably.
"It's all my fault. So I promise to at least save you." Hansel led me by the hand in the dark forest.\n"Don't worry. I'll save you, too." Hansel smiled sadly at my reply.
The old lady was crazy. She lays by my feet on the floor of her candy house. "Life at home will be easier if we bring this back," I smile. Hansel wipes his bloody hands.
I choose to live happily with Hansel, and won't forgive any who get in our way. Not even my parents. "Stop it!" he yells, and I do. Are you getting in my way too, Brother?

My shabby, soot-soaked self.\nA warm light shining over my darkest days.\nThat's you. A ray of hope, beaming from your castle.
This miracle happens once in a lifetime.\nNow I have a beautiful dress. A carriage and a coachman.\nA ball in your castle, unbeknownst to my family.
I flutter gracefully through the room.\nAren't I beautiful, my prince?\nDon't you want me as your princess?
The ringing wedding bells play a dirge for hope.\nAnother impoverished girl smiles by his side.\nHow I hate that cinder-soiled girl. What made her so different?

The Tokyo Board of Education has released its findings on the investigation of the 18-year-old girl who died after jumping from a Shinjuku building in early February.
The findings took into consideration the opinion of an independent panel of experts commissioned in May that states there was insufficient testimony from teachers and students.
The report reveals that bullying at school caused the girl's suicide. Superintendent Maeda showed remorse, saying he'll work to ensure such a case never occurs again.
The girl's father was openly hostile with reporters, saying, "I'm furious with the Board of Education. They didn't even start to investigate until experts told them to."
It was X-mas Eve. The girl was on a mysterious journey\nin her dreams along with the nutcracker her uncle had given her.\nToy soldiers, mice kings, candy lands, and a prince...
A few days after waking from her wonderful dream, she placed the doll in a box.\nThe dream was over, X-mas had passed and the old nutcracker\nhad no role apart from cracking nuts.
The doll was eventually forgotten by the girl. It grumbled in its neglected storage.\n"She shows me no respect. I am the ultimate doll. I do not deserve to be treated this way."
The nutcracker complained incessantly. He complained about her new toys, her new favorites, and sometimes about her herself. In the end, he became junk on a trash heap.
Princess Kaguya was born from bamboo. A man who'd heard of her beauty snuck into her bedchamber. Shocked, she began to beat him, viciously, until he no longer drew breath.
"What should I do? I didn't mean for this...." The princess was flustered, but her grandparents did not scold her. "You did nothing wrong. He was just weak, that's all."
"A man doesn't deserve to have you unless he's strong."\n"I'm sure a tough man worthy of taking you will appear one day." Princess Kaguya took their words to heart.
Princess Kaguya waits for the strong gentleman who will take her in his arms. Who will use them to pin her down, by force if necessary. She waits, but he never appears...
Humans commit sins...\nDespite knowing the wrongness of their ways.\nThat is because the human heart is weak.
Humans hate justice...\nDespite knowing of its righteousness.\nThat is because the human heart is frail.
The demons who deceive men are kind, sweet, and beautiful.\nThat is why I fight back with a strong heart.\nI believe in the justice of my violence.
I am Justice itself. Mine is the path of righteousness.\nAll who defy me are wicked, and I shall strike them down.\nO Lord, is my justice a sin?
A girl was found late last night on the backstreets of East Shinjuku, collapsed and covered in blood. She died soon after being sent to the hospital with abdominal wounds.
The area continues to be blocked off, and the murder weapon has yet to be found. The blood scattered everywhere speaks to the brutality of the crime.
The victim was an unemployed girl of 16. \nShe was last seen several months ago after she left home to visit her grandmother. This was not an isolated incident, so no missing person report was filed.
A 21-year-old Shinjuku restaurant manager was arrested for her murder based on fingerprints left at the crime scene. He has reportedly confessed to some of the charges.

Authorities have concluded that the body found at Shin-Koiwa station belonged to a woman working in the metropolitan area. Investigators have ruled it as a potential suicide and are currently questioning persons of interest.

To continue our coverage of the accident at Shin-Koiwa Station, police have taken a 40 year-old man into custody after he confessed to pushing the victim, a co-worker he had been having an extra-marital affair with, into the train tracks when she demanded he married her.
The dawn's early light guides me steadily onward from the cold, dark night.
Singing of spring's death, a single, precious flower flutters to the ground.
The sun's vengeful rays beat down upon the city—my body, ablaze.
Tall looms the tower my fate, to perish alone—a dismal future.
My kimono sleeves sweep down, long and elegant—my movements, restrained.
A tightly-cinched towel bulks me up around the waist—my movements, restrained.
The bow at my back squeezes the breath out of me—my movements, restrained.
Blood-stains splatter me, crimson weighing down my sleeves—my movements, restrained.
I can't help but laugh when supplicants raise their hands to the New Year's sky.
My blade severs them: No one wants to hear your prayers—you're wasting your breath.
Spit in one hand, make your wishes in another—tell me which fills first?
Faces of the weak cries for mercy on their lips—I tread upon them.
Am I truly just? The thought crosses my mind from time to time. \nThe corpses of nightmare after nightmare pile at my feet.\nSo I wonder, is there enough justice inside of me to take their lives?
The wails of nightmares echo in my ears.\nHelp me, they cry. Help me. I don't want to die. What did we do to deserve this?\nSplatters of blood stain my white dress red. Whose blood is it? Is it mine?
Filth does not become me. I must correct this. \nBut what is correct? Who sets the rules? The law? Customs? Instinct?\nI don't know! I don't know! Oh, but wait…perhaps I do.

I am justice—I will decide. Evil-doers must be punished, extenuating circumstances be damned. They will all die. If they will not go quietly, then let it be at my own hand. Ah, much better. Don't you see how beautiful the world has become?
Early yesterday morning, residents reported an explosion accompanied by fire in a local apartment. The body of an unidentified young woman was found in the wreckage.
Residents complained of an irritating smell after the blast, \nreporting eye and nose irritation. Authorities believe the fire generated \nan outbreak of toxic gas, and have cordoned off the area.
The body is believed to belong to a university student. \nAuthorities are investigating signs of suspicious activity after locating fragments of metal and various chemicals in her apartment.

Investigators discovered that the deceased had been in contact with global terrorist organizations via social media, and have launched a thorough investigation after discovering what appears to be a homemade bomb in the wreckage of the apartment.

Once upon a time in a land far, far away, there lived \nthree hungry piggies, each in their own home. The first \nlittle piggy built her house of hay, while the second built hers of wood. But the third piggy was more clever than her sisters, and built hers of brick.
One day, a hungry wolf came to fill its tummy. \nWith barely a huff and nary a puff, it blew down the houses made \nof hay and wood, gobbling up the two porky piggies.
But the third little piggy had a trap waiting for the big, bad wolf.\n The wolf tumbled into a boiling cauldron, howling for mercy as it bubbled away. \n…Goodness, doesn't that smell good?
The piggy gobbled up her yummy dinner, and her poor little sisters traveled into yet another tummy. To eat, be eaten, and eat again… So goes this never-ending tale of gluttony.
Statement (given by the eldest stepsister):\nMy foot! It hurts! My heels and toes are soaked in blood! I don't even care about the glass slippers anymore! Just please, make it stop!
Statement (given by the youngest stepsister):\nMother told me to cut my foot down to fit the slipper... Who needs to walk when you're a princess, anyway?
Statement (given by the stepmother):\nShe whispered lies to me, that devilish little girl! Saying, "Why-ever would they need feet if they were princesses?"

Conclusion:\nForgive my candor, but your family is bred of foolish stock. Why, we were engaged before the dance was even over! How I love you, my clever, beautiful wife. Even your nasty streak is charming.
Far from the castle walls, deep in the forest, seven tiny men lived in a quaint little cottage. The hard-working little men dug in their mine every day, looking for silver and gold.

"I wish we had someone to handle the housework," one of the little men griped one day. They loathed slaving over their dinners after dragging their weary bodies back from the quarry, after all. The little men all nodded along in agreement.

They put together a list of their demands. "We need someone to do our cleaning." "And the laundry!" "Don't forget the darning." "But we won't pay a red cent for it!" And on and on it went. One day, a lost human woman wandered across their cottage.

The seven little men welcomed their visitor with open arms. After all, the bigger the human, the more abuse she could take. They would work her to the bone and sell her off once they'd gotten what they could out of her. After all, she wasn't part of their family…

\n　　My　　　　mind is　　　　　　　　breaking　into pieces.\n

\n　　　　　　　　　　　I will kill　you.\n
The body of a young man (17) was found hanging in his home on the 9th. The deceased had completely withdrawn from society and had been truant from school for the past six months.

Those involved with the case have indicated the deceased was under considerable emotional distress after his information had been leaked online in an apparent "dox" attack due to a dispute over a streaming website.
However, investigators are reluctant to rule the case as a suicide, as no letter was found at the scene. The investigation continues as both a potential homicide and suicide.

A threatening message was posted online prior to the incident. \nIt read, "Tomorrow, you die. I'll rape you, then murder you and hang the body, you worthless deadbeat. No one will be sad to see you go."
[Exclusive Story: The Mysterious Dead Beauty] \nThe body of a stunning beauty was found sprawled in her bed in a luxury hotel the other day, not a stitch of fabric to cover her naked curves.
Her voluptuous figure was dressed in countless welts and bruises, the faintest trace of a tight rope on her ankle.\nAn array of adult toys lay strewn about the bed.
The lovely victim was, in fact, a well-known masochist, particularly fond of bondage, whipping, and so much more. \nRumor had it that she was hunting for something more extreme.

Subverting expectations that her death came of a troubled love affair, the coroner's report revealed that the masochistic mistress's demise was accidentally caused by her own hand!\n She may be missed, but one thing's for sure: she found the punishment she craved.

Mermaid \ ˈmər-ˌmād \\n A creature of myth, having the upper body of a human but the lower half of a fish.\n They are considered a symbol of misfortune in some cases; an allegory for tragic love in others.
Tragic love \ ˈtra-jik ˈləv \\n An unattainable love. To never be with the person to whom your heart belongs.\n Readers regularly demand tales of these impossible romances.
Demand \ di-ˈmand \\n To require or ask for something. Without demand, there is no supply.\n Stories of misery only exist because readers demand that they do.

Misery \ ˈmi-zə-rē \\n A state of suffering, grief. People set their minds at ease by showing others compassion.\n A life without misery is one without peace…… And that is why I seek out misery, wherever it may be.
His head is empty, but his mind is sharp.\nHe isn't alive, but then again, he is.\nMy dear friend, The Scarecrow.
His body may be tin, but his heart is kind.\nHe appears to be dead, but still he lives.\nMy dear friend, The Woodcutter.
The king of beasts, whose cowardice belies the stout heart hiding within.\nHe hates being alive, but it is all he craves.\nMy dear friend, The Lion.

I never want to leave them.\nIf only I could carry a piece of them with me, no matter how far apart we may be.\nI know! I'll chop their bodies into tiny pieces and carry them with me in a jar of jam...
My name is Snow White. Untainted white.\nWhite for innocence and justice. White for all the injustices brought to light.\n　　I am White. White for the spotless, untainted color I wear.
Come before me, black-hearted sinners, and lay bare your misdeeds. \nMy gun will pierce your darkness with a bullet of white light.

My white... You've contaminated it. 　　　Stained it with your dark filth.\n　　　　The darkness of your heart looks down upon the beauty of white.\n　　But have no fear, for I am the purest of Whites. I can never be soiled by its black stains.

Snow White. Darkest Dark. Pure White. Blackest Black. The two should never, ever be allowed to meet.\n　　　　　...In that case, the most hateful world of all……\nIt's a world colored in contemptible, impure ash, devoid of white and black alike.

What makes me happy? Going back to sleep on a clear, sunny morning.\nThat's why I set my alarm clock just a little bit ahead.\nI don't mind waking up in the afternoon. I could even sleep until night, if I wanted to.
Then I wake up as the sun sets, and my shoulders sag.\nI say, "Aww, I wasted another day."\nAnd then I roll over, my heart heavy with regret, and fall back asleep. What could be better than that?
Nothing happens when people sleep. The clock keeps ticking and the world moves on without them. They don't work, they don't move, they have no use! Why should we let them live!?
But that's okay; they're better off asleep. While those useless humans are off in slumberland, I can do whatever I want to them (even kill them!), just as long as they're sleeping...

One day, Mr. Geppetto came across a log that spoke the language of humans.\nHe fashioned the log into a puppet and then—wonder of wonders!—it began to move about, just like a little boy.\nHe named this little puppet Pinocchio.

But Pinocchio was a naughty little puppet who loved mischief.\nHe told lies, and crushed the poor cricket who tried to set him on the right path.\nWhen his selfish ways caught up with him, Pinocchio was torn from his father's arms.

Lonely Pinocchio soon found himself robbed and hanged...\nBut then a fairy happened upon him, taking pity on his poor state.\nShe bequeathed to him a curse that would stretch his nose when he lied, while telling him that one day, if he behaved, he would become a real boy.

Pinocchio, now determined to be good, had a brilliant idea.\nIf he couldn't behave on his own, he wouldn't do anything at all.\nIf he "depended" on other people to make his decisions for him, then surely he'd become a wonderful person, just like the fairy.
Scarecrow (sker-ˌkrō)\n1. Dorothy's companion and/or victim. 2. One who seeks knowledge. \n3. A foolish individual who's sharper than anyone, but doesn't realize it.
Tin Woodsman (ˈtin ˈwu̇dz-mən) \n1. Dorothy's companion and/or victim. 2. One who craves a heart. \n3. A ruthless individual who won't hesitate to kill despite longing for a warm heart.
Lion (ˈlī-ən) \n1. Dorothy's companion and/or victim. 2. One who craves courage. \n3. An individual who claims to be cowardly, yet shows no reservations about baring his fangs to strangers.
Dorothy (ˈdȯr|əthē-) \n1. A courageous adventurer. 2. One who possesses an insatiable hunger for inquiry. \n3. An individual who brings about peoples' deaths despite no ill intent. 4. A murderer.
The Little Mermaid bobbed along the waves, waiting for her destiny. \nShe daydreamed of the moment her dreams would come true. \nBut from time to time, destiny needs a push in the right direction.

Time passed, and a single ship caught her eye. She gave a tantalizing flick of her tail, and a handsome prince, no doubt thinking she was a fish, crossed the deck to investigate.\nOne look into his eyes and she was convinced. He would be hers.

A sudden squall assaulted the ship, throwing all aboard into the churning waters.\nThe mast cracked in two, and pieces of the ship and the bodies of her crew surged across the waters.\nThe Little Mermaid clung to the unconscious prince's body, gazing upon the spectacle with tears in her eyes.

A tragic accident. Screams echoing within a storm.\nWhat a marvelous backdrop for a fated encounter! Thus did the Little Mermaid take fate into her own hands, spinning her own tragic tale of love.\nSuch a heart-wrenching tragedy... One that was certainly worth steering a ship into a storm for.

Our special feature today is on "Vegetables," another term for patients in deep states of slumber. Our investigation follows on such woman, digging deep into her family's turbulent, dramatic situation.

The longer our coverage continued, the more fantasy and reality began to diverge. Though the parents wished to go on with the treatment, they were confronted with rapidly increasing costs. The tranquil face of their sleeping daughter began to contrast with the faces of the family, colored by exhaustion.

Just weeks after we began filming, the girl's condition took a turn for the worse and she exhaled her final breath. Everyone said it happened in an instant. The long, long battle fought by the family was thus brought to a bitter end.

Days later, we received some astonishing news. The girl's death occurred at the behest of her mother. After trying for so long to keep her alive, why had she resorted to such means? We decided to continue with our coverage.

Interim Report on Library Characters\nName: Cinderella/Home town: Multiple locations around the world \nPersonality traits: Cruel and cynical. Her high self esteem is over-shadowed by hints of darker emotions.

Origin: Cendrillon, Grimm Brothers Fairy Tale Collection, Tale of Tales \nActual origin undetermined. Similar stories have been passed down in several countries. The version by the French Poet Charles Perrault and that by the Grimm Brothers are particularly famous.

Narrative: Abused by her stepmother and stepsisters, a young lady is forced to work as a servant. She is aided by a sorceress and attends a ball at the castle where the prince falls in love with her at first sight. However, as the time limit of her magic spell nears its end, she flees the castle and leaves behind a glass slipper.

Present: What happened after she became a princess is unclear. Did she actually achieve revenge against her stepmother and stepsisters? The gates to the castle that she reached at last are closed firm. A story with a happy ending needs no afterword.

\nWe've received reports that a person was left dead in the city after a meeting of the XX mafia gang. The victim was said to be a female associate of the gang and at present, the police \nare gathering details from those at the scene.

Previous reports were received that an internal struggle had intensified within the XX gang and the situation was perceived to be\n dangerous. As the female victim may have been involved in the struggle, the police\n suspect foul play but are also considering the possibility that there was an accident.

Regarding the death of a female associate of the XX gang, \ntraces of several narcotics were found in the victim's bloodstream and it is believed that she \nmay have been lacking in self control at the time of the incident.

The woman was the wife of one of the gang's leaders \nand is said to have quarreled with the man recently. She is believed to have made a sudden appearance at the meeting \nwith an illegal firearm and committed suicide.

It's dark, so very dark, in the forest. The longer I remain in the darkness, the more\nI begin to feel like my elder brother is with me. Right behind me, I can hear my brother's footsteps. I can hear my brother's voice whispering in my—

There. Can't you feel it? My brother's breath on my neck.\nYou're there, aren't you, big brother? You know it's me, don't you, brother?\nPlease take my hand. Like you did long ago. Like you did that night.

Ahhh... I remember the touch of those hands. Your arms, your skin.\nYour arms were so thin, big brother. Your skin was so smooth. I could never mistake your beautiful body for anyone else.\nWhen I touch you, please touch me back, Big Brother. Oh!

My elder brother's left hand runs over my body. My right runs over his body.\nHis fingers are against my neck. My fingers are against his neck. The pulse flowing through his veins fills me with warmth. Hold me tight, Big Brother— We will be together forever.
Alone, gazing through the bamboo at the hazy moon.\nWet with tears at the multitude of stars.\n...My elder brother and me, inhuman. Lonely. Beloved.
The rhythmic sounds of the rainy season. \nThe moistened smell of the soaked earth fierce rain, wet soil. The drumming of the droplets comforts me.
I cast my thoughts toward the crescent moon.\nDoes it wish to be loved in its fractured shape? \n...The fractured moon is my reflection. I cannot be satisfied. I lack too much.
The moon's bright, frozen light strikes the skin.\nThe pain that fills my body makes me tremble with joy.\n...The scorning light of a cold moon. Pain itself is the pathos at the heart of all things.

A library of many tales. Here you will find those rare occasions where elements of a story have slipped through the cracks and become lost. The beautiful girl before us now is one of those. It all began one day, when she met a spirit in the guise of a lion.

Hearing the girl's plaintive pleas to return to her world, the spirit offered her a trade. If she agreed to certain conditions, it would use its mysterious powers to take her home. The story is set in the world of the Queen of Hearts and the Mad Hatter. A curious universe.

The girl happily agreed and the spirit prepared her to receive its power, as promised. The girl accepted the spirit's power. As time passed, she began using the power to kill the inhabitants of that world, one by one. She murdered and pillaged, burning the forest to the ground.

As her ego wore away, the girl clung more and more to the spirit's power. It gradually transformed her appearance into something dark and ominous. One day, another girl and a cat appeared before her. "I've come to kill me!" The monster who was once the girl chuckled loudly.

This is the story of a snake consumed with envy. It is a story of love between a beautiful woman and a hideous serpent. Long ago, the beautiful woman was the snake's master and one night, she attended a ball that was to serve as the prince's search for a bride. There were many rivals and it was a challenge to remain until the end.

For the sake of its beautiful master, the serpent killed her rivals one by one and all ended well with her marriage to the prince. So, the next thing the snake did was kill the Prince. After all, he was a rival for its masters love. But then what happened…?

How terrible - the snake was killed by its beloved master! The poor serpent. Love had turned to obsession and even after obtaining a cursed power, it could not be satisfied. One day, the snake met a girl trapped in delusion and begged to be loved.

The snake gave its power to the girl. However, no matter how much the girl's identity disintegrated, transforming into that of a beast, she desired only her older brother. The snake's love remained unrequited and the world had another monster. And that is where this story ends. They all lived happily ever after.

"What do you want to be when you grow up?" \nI want to be a school teacher, a doctor and a nurse.\n I even want to be a police officer and a food vendor.
My mommy and daddy told me that doing all of them would be hard. So I decided to pick just one. \nBut I couldn't choose.
I asked my mommy and daddy what they wanted me to be. They said "we want you to be a person of honesty and character. We want you to do the right thing at all times".
So, now I want to be a person who does right. I want to be someone who helps those in need. But what does it mean to do right? I don't know and I want to learn.

The tiger spirit drowned by the beautiful woman tells its tale. \n──Cinderella is a woman of extravagant flavor. The taste of her pure evil is refreshing enough. But that hatred fermented by long years of abuse is the ultimate spice.
The only hitch was the capricious Prince coming to the rescue. If not for that, she would have been a real gourmet dish.

By comparison, the other repressed souls are rather bland. Omnivores make for tough meat and taste terrible. On top of that, they have absorbed very few nutrients. There were three of them and yet, I am left terribly disappointed.

Moving on, the next catch of the day is… hmm, that one. Let's try a taste of the soul who finds pleasure in its own abuse. Ah, my stomach is growling. My mouth is watering and my chest is throbbing! \nI'll be reduced to a mere beast before I've had the chance to enjoy my meal.

Dorothy was sucked into a tornado and found herself deposited in an unfamiliar country.\nTo get back to her hometown, she must see the Wizard of Oz, who is said to grant wishes of every kind. That is how the journey of Dorothy and her pet dog Toto began.

Her travel companions were the Scarecrow who wanted a brain, the Tin Woodsman who wanted a heart, and the cowardly Lion who wanted courage.\nIn pursuit of their wishes, they worked together and proceeded down a road fraught with many dangers.

In the midst of those travels, the Scarecrow develops clever plans, the Tin Woodsman looks out for his friends, and the Lion shows valor in confronting his enemies. Dorothy has a realization.\nPerhaps, my companions already have what they've been seeking—

The seeds of this suspicion continued to grow in Dorothy's mind. She wanted to know more. She wanted to research—the kingdom, its people, her companions—she wanted to know what was inside them. Surrendering to her inquisitive mind without hesitation, she grabbed a weapon—

Having fallen in love with the prince, Little Mermaid made a plea to the witch of the sea. "Please make me a human!"\n"As you wish. But know that your new legs will feel pain for as long as you live. Walking will feel like you've been stabbed with a blade."
"That's not all... No. As payment, I shall receive that beautiful voice of yours. You will never be able to speak to your friends again. Do you still want to proceed?

The witch had done her best to dissuade the princess and now she named one last condition.\n"If your love is not requited, your heart will burst into foam and you will die." At those words, Little Mermaid began to cry.

"But that's too cruel..." "Yes. And that is why—" "That's exactly why...I want you to make me human". To the witch's astonishment, she could now see that Little Mermaid's pupils were wet with tears, while her face bore a broad smile.
So then, how shall we play today? Shall I stitch my stomach with needle and thread?\nIf I'm to do that, I have to cut it open first!\nAh! Scissors! Snip, snip, snip...
Before I knew it, my right arm was dyed in crimson.\nThe scissors in my hand were covered with white lard.\nHmm? What's going on? My stomach's been ripped open?
Oh no! I must stitch it up quick!\nThe rusted needle and stiff thread thump against my stomach.\nThe pain. The horrible pain. Oh, it hurts! But...it's so much fun! It feels so good...!!

All I want to do is play. But I have no one to play with. So, I cut and mutilate myself. It's very fun, painful, frightening, and comforting. I want to show everyone how to do it. I have to show them. I must play more and spread the fun! More, more!
Sleep (noun)\nThe act of sleeping. A comatose state.  The curse placed on Sleeping Beauty. \nEg.: "Rather than the curse of death, the princess has been inflicted with a hundred-year sleep."
Sound sleep (adj.-noun)\n Peaceful sleep. Remaining comatose for a sufficient period of rest. Sleeping Beauty's greatest desire.\nEg.: "No one will disturb me here, so I can get a sound sleep."
Nap (noun)\nTo sleep without finishing daily tasks. Sleeping Beauty's greatest source of joy. \nEg: "How wonderful it would be to nap all the time–"
Eternal sleep (adj.-noun)\nSleep that lasts forever. Death. A state beyond Sleeping Beauty's understanding. \nEg.: "If I achieve eternal sleep, I can dream forever, right?"
August 31st. \nTwo grown-ups were kissing in the park. How gross. I should tell my teacher. I think I will.
September 2nd\n My teacher says that when people grow up, they find a lover. All my friends cackled with embarrassment.
September 4th\n My teacher says that when people find a lover, they "get married". What does that mean - ‘Married'?
September 6th\n My lover has not yet appeared. But I'm sure he'll be handsome. Ahhh… I want to get married, too.

The boy departed alone from a small house and walked to the fountain in town. He could not read music. But he had a good ear. He needed only to hear a song once before he could play it. The sounds that emerged as the boy squeezed his accordion were soft and beautiful.

The cute girl with the chestnut hair was a regular audience member. She lived in the biggest house in town and always stopped for two songs before spreading her lips in a childlike smile and walking away. The boy's days were spent in squalor, but peaceful nonetheless.

One day, he heard the voice of a kitten. It was a tiny sound that would have been missed by lesser ears. The boy wrapped the kitten in his only shirt and hurried home with it in his arms. That was how they met.

The boy began living with the cat. He took good care of it and it became fond of him as well. From that point, the number of spectators who witnessed his playing mysteriously increased and his life grew in comfort. Those were happy days. Or at least they were until he was locked up.
Patient name: Pinocchio\nMain complaint: Doesn't know why he is here.\nSuffers from vague anxiety. Wants to be commanded by others.

Name of illness: Dependent personality disorder (working hypothesis) \nInitial observation: Shows a tendency to defer his decision making to others.\nAs he has ceased thinking for himself, a dulling of his emotions can also be seen.
Name of illness: Delusion (working hypothesis)\nInitial observations: refers to himself as a puppet.\nClaims his nose grows when he lies.

Other/additional details (subjective): During diagnosis, he repeatedly claimed, "the staff tells me to kill."\nAs suspected, the likelihood of a delusional disorder is high ■z3578rffsf\nThe diagnosis data suddenly cuts off here.

This medication is a coating agent. \nThe cost shall be paid in walnuts - enough to break a jaw. \n14 days dosage provided. Apply as necessary to affected area once a day.

This medication has been prepared to deal with this haphazardly organized summer event. \nIt is an anti-hyperallergenic and side-effects include intense hatred of injustice\n and a tendency to push one's self too far.

Reference: Since this is her second time in a swimsuit, there will not be much novelty. \nPlease do not compare amount of skin shown to first time. We thank you for your \nunderstanding with regard to active promotion of the generic variety.
To love. To lose love. To be betrayed. To be forgotten. To disappear. \nWhat a beautiful story. A flawless tragic masterpiece. I am the heroine. \nWhile drowning in my sadness, I heard a laugh.
"Hoo hee ha"……Who was that who laughed just now? \nTragedies are for tears. There is no room for "hoo hee ha" laughter. \nEven so "mua ha ha". Uhoh, could it be…me who is laughing?
What am I to do? The sadder I get, the more \nmy heart skips with excitement. I put the hehehe in tragic heroine. \nAt this rate it will be a… Tee-hee-hee tragic-comedy!

Everything is a tragedy. Hahaha. Tragedy is comedy. Eeheehee. Suffering is humor. \nOohoohoo. Sorrow is stimulating. Hehehe. Unhappiness is happiness. Ohoho. \nSo laugh all you want. Laugh. Laugh. more… Until the tears come.

Quiz time. Put your thinking caps on. First question… What kind of food is prepared by removing the blood, storing it, pulling out the intestines, filling the intestines with the stored blood, and then stuffing everything back inside?

The answer is: "blood sausage". Next question… What meal is prepared by giving the animal lots and lots and lots of food to eat, making it as fat as possible, then eating the fatty liver that results?
The answer to the previous question was foie gras. Now, the next question. What is the word for eating something that is still alive?
"Ah."\nThat was the last thing said by the doll who had up until now posed riddles. As the doll danced in a panic, a tiger-like creature swallowed it whole, burped loudly, and left the scene.

"Oh no! Oh my! I'm late! So very late!"
The rabbit glanced at a broken watch and dove into a black hole.
Alice followed. She had no idea what lay beyond.
"What do you get when you cross a crow with a desk for study?"\nThe man who asked Alice this question was wearing  a hat of strange design.\nAlice could not answer. There was no answer.
"In that case, off with your head!" the Queen screamed, hysterically.\nHearing that, Alice tightened her grip on the knife she held.\nAfter all, she didn't want to be killed.

This was the curious kingdom of Wonderland. A curious place where no other soul resided.\nAlice stood at the center of that curious kingdom.\nShe was holding a broken and blood-stained watch, a hat, and a knife.
The gift was a curse I received on my birthday.\nIt is filled with dreams. Reality is what's boring.\nRight now, I just don't want to wake up.
Here, sweets fall from cotton candy clouds. I can catch each one on my tongue.\nThe whole world is mine to eat.\nI just don't want to wake up, yet.
Thorns pierce my side. I am all pus and scars.\nI'm in pain, Dear Prince. Please just let me be.\nNo matter what, I don't want to wake up.

Thanks to the sorcerer's magic, Sleeping Beauty escaped death.\nBut one who refuses to wake up might as well be dead, anyway.\nAware of that truth or not, the princess spends another day adrift in her dreams...
All I want is for someone to love me. I loved her more than that Prince ever did. No matter how great my love, I received no love in return. Because I am ugly. Because I am an ugly snake.

For the Prince, I reserved the special treatment of death by strangulation. That handsome face of which he was so proud warped into a hideous state and at the end, he turned black and ceased moving. I was relieved. Because now the Prince was ugly too. An ugly corpse.
My beloved had also grown wicked, hypnotized by her desire for status and power. Your presence when you killed me actually put me at peace. Because now, even you were ugly. A woman of hideous heart!
In the end, however, all it meant was that I was alone again. Why does no one understand me? All I did was love her and desire her love in return, nothing more.

In a certain village, there lived a beautiful and virtuous maiden. She shared an intimate life with her quiet, steadfast husband. But even then, an endless stream of men would visit her to beg for a single night of her love.

One rainy night, a woman appeared before the desperate crowd of men. \n"This love potion is made from a scorpion's poison. Even the most virtuous of women cannot resist it." \nThe men received the potion and plotted to visit the maiden when her husband was absent.

The potion made the maiden lose her senses and aroused her desires. She drowned herself in ecstasy with the men. One day, however, the husband returned home earlier than expected and shot both his wife and the men with his hunting rifle. He then pointed the rifle at his own head and pulled the trigger.

"How terrible. But this time, we will have even more tragedy!"\n Little Mermaid handed over the potion and demanded a new round of tragic events. The depths she fell to after indulging in the scorpion's power are best left unstated.

Now we shall relate the story of a certain man. This man was impoverished in both mind and soul. Utterly without spirit, he was despised by all.\nHe desired nothing and loved no one. His heart was a mere void.
In a strange twist of fate, the man came to possess a magic lamp.\nThe lamp gave him unlimited riches.\nWith his wealth, the man earned love, gained status, and eventually became king of his realm.
All who had once scorned the man now showered him with praise.\nThey gathered at his feet to feed on the scraps of his good fortune.\nThe man's heart was satisfied in a way he never dreamed possible.
However, there was something he failed to notice. Where wealth brings happiness, it also carries envy and animosity... The man only realized this after his beloved wife had her life taken.

If you earn over 1500 points, a V e r. will be added where the oldest pig in her house of straw and the middle pig in her house of sticks are also rescued. When the brick house of the youngest pig is destroyed, the game is over.
